alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Lee; Moore; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:06PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Moore, northwestern Harnett, Lee, southwestern Wake and eastern Chatham Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 405 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Pittsboro to 9 miles east of Seagrove. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Sanford, Pittsboro, Jordan Lake, Fuquay-Varina, Goldston, Apex, Holly Springs and Morrisville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Boaters on the open water and those camping outdoors are especially vulnerable to the dangers of lightning. Seek harbor immediately and find safe shelter in a nearby building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
